hero.title: Welcome to Springfield Academy
hero.subtitle: Nurturing Minds, Building Futures. Discover a place where learning comes alive.

about.title: About Springfield Academy
about.description: Founded in 1985, Springfield Academy is dedicated to providing an enriching and challenging educational environment where students can thrive academically, creatively, and personally.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To inspire a passion for learning, foster critical thinking, and empower students to become compassionate and engaged global citizens.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: To be a leading educational institution recognized for innovation, academic excellence, and a commitment to nurturing the potential within every student.

values.title: Our Values
values.description: We uphold integrity, respect, collaboration, and a relentless pursuit of knowledge, creating a supportive and inclusive community for all.

early.title: Early Years Program
early.description: A play-based curriculum that fosters curiosity and social development for our youngest learners (Ages 3-5).

elementary.title: Elementary School
elementary.description: Building strong foundational skills in literacy, numeracy, and science with a focus on collaborative learning (Grades 1-5).

middle.title: Middle School
middle.description: Encouraging critical thinking and independence as students explore a wider range of subjects (Grades 6-8).

high.title: High School
high.description: A rigorous college-preparatory program with diverse AP course offerings and extracurricular activities (Grades 9-12).

stem.title: STEM & Robotics
stem.description: A specialized track for students passionate about science, technology, engineering, and math, with hands-on projects.

arts.title: Arts & Humanities
arts.description: Fostering creativity and cultural understanding through programs in visual arts, music, theater, and literature.

admissions.title: Admissions Process
admissions.description: We welcome you to apply to Springfield Academy. Our admissions process is designed to be straightforward and transparent. Please follow the steps below to begin your journey with us.

application.title: Submit Online Application
application.description: Complete our online application form and submit the required documents, including academic transcripts and letters of recommendation.

assessment.title: Entrance Assessment
assessment.description: Applicants for Grades 6-12 will be invited to complete an entrance assessment covering mathematics and language arts.

interview.title: Family Interview
interview.description: Shortlisted candidates and their families will be invited for an interview with our admissions committee to discuss goals and expectations.

decision.title: Admissions Decision
decision.description: Decision letters are sent out within two weeks of the family interview. We look forward to welcoming new students to our community!

orientation.title: New Student Orientation
orientation.description: A special day for our new students to get acquainted with the campus, teachers, and their fellow classmates.

firstDayFall.title: First Day of School (Fall Semester)
firstDayFall.description: Welcome back, everyone! The official first day of the fall academic semester.

openHouse.title: Back-to-School Night & Open House
openHouse.description: Parents are invited to meet teachers, learn about the curriculum, and tour the classrooms.

conferences.title: Parent-Teacher Conferences
conferences.description: Scheduled meetings for parents and teachers to discuss student progress. School is dismissed at noon.

lastDayFall.title: Last Day of School (Fall Semester)
lastDayFall.description: End of the fall semester. Have a wonderful winter break!

firstDaySpring.title: First Day of School (Spring Semester)
firstDaySpring.description: Welcome back for the spring semester. Let's make it a great one!

hours.question: What are the school hours?
hours.answer: Our academic day runs from 8:30 AM to 3:30 PM, Monday through Friday. Extracurricular activities may extend beyond these hours.

deadline.question: What is the application deadline for the next academic year?
deadline.answer: The primary application deadline for the upcoming school year is February 15th. We have a rolling admissions process after that date, depending on availability.

aid.question: Do you offer financial aid or scholarships?
aid.answer: Yes, Springfield Academy offers need-based financial aid. Families are encouraged to apply through our Financial Aid office. We also have a number of academic and merit-based scholarships.

ratio.question: What is the student-to-teacher ratio?
ratio.answer: We pride ourselves on maintaining a low student-to-teacher ratio of 12:1, ensuring personalized attention and a supportive learning environment for every student.

extracurricular.question: What extracurricular activities are available?
extracurricular.answer: We offer a wide range of activities, including sports teams (soccer, basketball, swimming), clubs (robotics, debate, chess), and arts programs (theater, choir, orchestra).

parent.quote: Springfield Academy has been a transformative experience for our daughter. The dedicated teachers and engaging curriculum have fostered a true love of learning.

alumnus.quote: As an alumnus, I can confidently say that the foundation I received at Springfield prepared me for every challenge in college and beyond. The community is second to none.

student.quote: The small class sizes and individual attention helped me discover my passion for science. I always feel supported and encouraged by my teachers and peers.
